name: Vegetarian Southwestern Potato Skins
author: Soup Loving Nicole
summary: Crispy potato skins with a Southwest kick. The key to crispy skins is the double-dose oil treatment. Serve with a dollop of guacamole or sour cream if desired.
ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained
1 small jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced
directions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Prick potatoes a few times with a fork
Rub potatoes with 1 teaspoon oil and set directly on the oven rack
Transfer to a cutting board and let cool until easily handled
Cut the potatoes lengthwise and scoop out flesh to within 1/4 inch of skin
Brush remaining oil over the skins and sprinkle with salt
Place them on a baking sheet skin-side down and bake for 5 minutes
Meanwhile, combine black beans, corn, picante sauce, jalapeno, onion, lime juice, and cumin in a bowl
Divide filling between the potatoes and top with Cheddar cheese
Bake until cheese has melted, about 5 minutes
